articles.title: China coronavirus outbreak: All the latest updates
articles.description: Hubei province reports 132 new deaths and 1,693 new infections pushing the nationwide total close to 75,000.
articles.content:
The number of deaths in China's central Hubei province from a coronavirus outbreak had risen by 132 to 1,921 as of Tuesday, the province's health commission said in a statement on its website on Wednesday.

articles.title: Coronavirus prompts 'hysterical, shameful' Sinophobia in Italy
articles.description: Chinese-Italian community subjected to assaults, insults and boycotts of businesses following deadly epidemic in China.
articles.content: The deadly outbreak of a new coronavirus in China has triggered a "hysterical" and "shameful wave of Sinophobia" in Italy, according to members of the Chinese Italian community and a rights group, with Italians and tourists of Chinese and Asian origin reporti… [+8069 chars]

articles.author: Febriana Firdaus
articles.title: Why are there no reported cases of coronavirus in Indonesia?
articles.description: Experts say there could be undetected coronavirus cases in Indonesia, a claim that has angered officials in Jakarta.
articles.content:
Jakarta/Denpasar, Indonesia - Nearly a month after the World Health Organization (WHO) declared the coronavirus outbreak a global health emergency, Indonesia is yet to report a single case.
Some experts, however, are raising questions over the lack of report… [+6307 chars]

articles.title: China continues to struggle with rising coronavirus cases
articles.description: New tough measures to test all citizens living in Wuhan as more than 3,000 health workers have also been infected.
articles.content:
China has announced tough new measures to test all citizens living in Wuhan as the government struggles to keep up with the rising number of coronavirus infections.

articles.title: Philippines 'ill-prepared' as it grapples with coronavirus threat
articles.description: Overworked healthcare staff fear exposure to virus as government faces criticism over $197m cuts in budget for health.
articles.content:
Manila, Philippines - The coronavirus, also known as COVID-19, has now killed more than 1,800 people and infected more than 72,000 others since it was first detected in China's city of Wuhan in December.

As millions return to major cities and resume work, they will be subject to unprecedented monitoring.
